When served, it has a dense, paste-like consistency...
raw_response:
**Bkaila** (also spelled pkaila or pkaïla) appears as a **very dark green to almost black, thick stew** made primarily from slow-cooked Swiss chard or spinach and white beans, sometimes enriched with meat or its vegan alternatives (seitan or tofu). When served, it has a dense, paste-like consistency rather than being soupy; the greens are cooked down for hours until almost confit-like, rendering a rich, oily, deeply colored base that resembles a thick, dark green stew**[2][3][6]**.
